subject: Class with main.
msgSnippet: Hi, I have a question how do I unit test a class with main function in it  and a private constructor. I have a class Checkboxes and another class
messageBody:
Hi,
I have a question how do I unit test a class with main function in it and a private constructor.

I have a class Checkboxes and another class CheckListPrototype. Then class CheckListPrototype has a main function and a private constructor which creates a window and and an instance of CheckBoxList which creates inturn creates checkboxes on the window.
now
final class CheckListPrototype extends JFrame {
public static void main(final String[] args) {
//$$$
// Create MessageDispatcher
MessageDispatcher messageDispatcher = MessageDispatcher.getInstance();

// Create Controller: CommandDispatcher + MessageProvider
IMessageProvider messageProvider = MessageProvider.getInstance(messageDispatcher);

messageDispatcher.setMessageProvider(messageProvider);

ICommandDispatcher commandDispatcher = CommandDispatcher.getInstance(messageProvider);
//$$$
new CheckListPrototype(commandDispatcher, messageDispatcher, messageProvider);
}

private CheckListPrototype(final ICommandDispatcher commandDispatcher, //$$$
final IMessageDispatcher messageDispatcher, //$$$
final IMessageProvider messageProvider) { //$$$
super("Check List Prototype");

//$$$
m_commandDispatcher = commandDispatcher;
m_messageDispatcher = messageDispatcher;
m_messageProvider = messageProvider;
//$$$
final int frameWidth = 350;
final int frameHeight = 220;
setSize(frameWidth, frameHeight);
JPanel rootPanel = (JPanel) getContentPane();
rootPanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout());

Dimension dim = getToolkit().getScreenSize();

m_objChkBoxList = new CheckBoxList (m_valuesInCheckList);

rootPanel.add(m_objChkBoxList, BorderLayout.CENTER);
m_submit = new JButton("Submit");
m_status = new JButton("Status");
JPanel buttonsPanel = new JPanel();
buttonsPanel.add(m_submit);
buttonsPanel.add(m_status);
rootPanel.add(buttonsPanel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
this.setLocation(dim.width / 2 - this.getWidth() / 2,
dim.height / 2 - this.getHeight() / 2);
this.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter() {
public final void windowClosing(final WindowEvent e) {
System.exit(0);
}
});


I have two questions.

the only test I can think of here is making sure that checkboxes are not checked when the window opens . i mean not familiar with Junit Testing so I really dont know ifthere could be any more cases and
how do i test it. I cant create an instance of CheckListPrototype since it has a private constructor.
ThankYou
Mona
